meanings.definition: A person who attends a party or event without being invited.
meanings.sent1: The crashers showed up at the party uninvited.
meanings.sent2: The party crashers brought their own snacks.
meanings.sent3: The crashers thought they were secret agents sneaking into a top-secret mission.
meanings.sent4: The crashers stormed the party like a sudden thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: The crashers left a lasting impression on the hosts with their unexpected arrival.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that causes a sudden loud noise or impact.
meanings.sent1: The crashers of the pots and pans startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent2: The car crashers caused a loud commotion on the street.
meanings.sent3: The crashers of the cymbals made the audience jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The crashers of the waves against the rocks echoed through the bay.
meanings.sent5: The crashers of the falling books made everyone turn their heads in the library.

meanings.definition: A computer program or virus that causes a system to malfunction or stop working.
meanings.sent1: The crashers in the code caused the computer to freeze.
meanings.sent2: The virus crashers infected the entire network.
meanings.sent3: The crashers in the system made the computer act like a grumpy robot.
meanings.sent4: The crashers in the software turned the screen into a digital puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The crashers in the program created chaos in the digital world.
